premium.definition: The amount paid by the policyholder to the insurer for coverage

benefit.definition: The amount paid by the insurer to the insured upon occurrence of an insured event

coverage amount.definition: The maximum amount guaranteed by the insurance policy

policy term.definition: The period during which the insurance policy remains in effect

payment period.definition: The period during which premiums must be paid

insured.definition: The person covered by the insurance policy

policyholder.definition: The person who owns the insurance policy and pays the premiums

beneficiary.definition: The person entitled to receive the insurance benefit

waiting period.definition: The period after policy inception during which coverage is not provided

renewable.definition: Insurance type where premiums are recalculated at regular intervals

non-renewable.definition: Insurance type where premiums remain fixed throughout the policy term

health insurance.definition: Insurance that covers actual medical expenses incurred

whole life insurance.definition: Insurance that provides coverage for the entire lifetime of the insured

term insurance.definition: Insurance that provides coverage for a specified period only

surrender value.definition: The amount refunded when canceling an insurance policy

rider.definition: Additional coverage attached to the main policy

main policy.definition: The basic contract of the insurance policy

duty of disclosure.definition: The obligation of the policyholder to disclose material facts at the time of application

exclusion.definition: Circumstances under which the insurer is not liable to pay benefits

policy document.definition: A document certifying the conclusion of an insurance contract
